Python 2.7, 3.6 | [![Build Status](https://jenkins-tensorflow.apps.ci.centos.org/buildStatus/icon?job=tensorflow-rhel7-3.6&build=2)](https://jenkins-tensorflow.apps.ci.centos.org/job/tensorflow-rhel7-3.6/2/) | [1.13.1 PyPI](https://tensorflow.pypi.thoth-station.ninja/index/) ## Resources * [TensorFlow.org](https://www.tensorflow.org)

comments.body:
Is this right? 
```
[![Build Status...
```
seems wrong.

Hi @drpngx . With `[![Build Status](<status_icon URL>)](<build machine URL>)`, when the user clicks on the status icon, it takes them to the build machine at <build machine URL> to get more details about the status. This is the way that IBM is doing the badge in the previous 3 rows. 

Conversely, in the Official Builds table with the pattern `![Status](<build status URL>)`, when the user clicks on the status icon, they are simply taken to the icon itself, not to the build machine. I assume this is because the official build machines are not publicly visible.

comments.body: This doesn't seem any better than what was there before.
I prefer the parallelism as "the graph edges" is used later on in the sentence.

comments.body: Thank you for adding this. However, we also have nightly windows gpu builds. Can you add the links as well? Just replace DEVICE=cpu with DEVICE=gpu in the URLs.
